is it there the missing picture is a

Rouge The Audacity of the missing
picture is equaled only by its
soulfulness the figurines in their
diorama like setting initially help keep
what happens on screen and somewhat of
an intellectual remove in time though
the clay figures begin to change as does
your relationship to them first they
become characters and then without
chemical mystery and deep feeling they
turn into people the depth of emotion
that mr. pond solicits from you is

Dargis writes while divergent celebrates
individuality and breaking out of the
little box that its authoritarian
leaders insist on putting teenagers in
the story sticks to the familiar gender
template girl warrior meets boy warrior
and in-between punches kicks and bullets
they hold hands lots of things happen of
course as per the dystopian rulebook but
for all the jumping and scaling of
heights the movie remains grounded but
it's finally going because women will
never break out of the representational
